name: Spinach and Cream Cheese Stuffed Chicken Breast
author: Julie
summary: This was a last-minute decision for my son's birthday dinner...mixing ingredients found in the refrigerator and kitchen...the family LOVED it! Adjust filling ingredients to your taste.
ingredients: ½ sleeve round buttery crackers, crushed fine
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Spray a baking pan with cooking spray
Heat a skillet over medium heat
Add oil, garlic, and onion
Cook and stir until tender, 1 to 3 minutes
Add ham and spinach leaves and stir until wilted, about 1 minute
Chop slightly in the skillet
Remove from heat and stir in cream cheese until melted and mixture has cooled a bit
Add Swiss cheese and set filling aside
Cut each chicken breast to 1/2 inch thickness and place in a bowl
Pour Italian dressing over chicken
Place 1 chicken breast on a cutting board and pound thinner
Add about 1/4 of the filling and fold chicken over to form a packet
Seal using toothpicks and place in the prepared baking pan
Repeat with remaining chicken breasts and filling
Combine crushed crackers and Cheddar cheese together in a bowl
Cover filled chicken breasts with cracker mixture, mashing them into the breasts
Bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes
Remove from oven and let sit for 10 minutes before transferring from the pan to a serving platter to allow filling to set up
Remove toothpicks before serving
